Instead of creating barriers that limit participation in the census, we should be breaking them down to ensure that every single person is counted.

Congress must take steps to immediately reverse this move, and blunt its impact.

If large swaths of people stop participating in the census, it will jeopardize the accuracy of our census, and impact everything from how we draw up congressional districts to allocation of $700 billion in federal funds.
It would discourage the more than 16 million people who live in mixed status families from participating in the census.

People are less likely to respond to the census out of fear of deportations, of putting their families at risk, of ‚Äòouting‚Äô themselves or their loved ones. This fear persist even among legal immigrants.

BREAKING: Trump administration moves to ask people about citizenship in the 2020 census. 

This is absurd. It will not only hurt open participation in the census, but also disproportionately impact immigrant communities. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DZTwyoeVMAAscHQ.jpg

Gun dealers who turn a blind eye to middle-men buying hundreds of weapons to sell on the streets use PLCAA to avoid legal liability. No one should be able to profit from gun deaths. Repeal PLCAA now.

Bars can be liable for accidents when they negligently sell alcohol to people they have reason to think will drive drunk. But under PLCAA, gun makers and dealers can escape accountability for similarly negligent conduct. The gun industry does not deserve special privileges.

In 2008, a gun shop owner was sued for allegedly selling a firearm to a fugitive off the books. The fugitive used this gun to kill a random bystander 2 days later. 

Despite repeated violations of federal gun laws, the seller was found to be immune from liability under PLCAA.

When other businesses are harmfully negligent, they can be held legally responsible. When it‚Äôs the gun industry, there are no consequences because the Protection of Lawful Commerce in Arms Act broadly shields them from liability.

We must repeal PLCAA now.
https://www.nytimes.com/2018/03/24/opinion/sunday/stop-shielding-gun-makers.html
